definitions.text: the act of intervening (as to mediate a dispute, etc.)
a policy of intervening in the affairs of other countries
the act or fact of interposing one thing between or among others

(law) a proceeding that permits a person to enter into a lawsuit already in progress; admission of person not an original party to the suit so that person can protect some right or interest that is allegedly affected by the proceedings
examples: the purpose of intervention is to prevent unnecessary duplication of lawsuits

definitions.text: care provided to improve a situation (especially medical procedures or applications that are intended to relieve illness or injury)
